snippet: Six United Nations military observers arrived overnight and were ready to begin, depending on the cooperation of the Syrian government, a spokesman for the special envoy Kofi Annan said.
abstract: United Nations cease-fire observers begin working in Damascus, Syria, to establish ground rules with the Syrian government, even as activist videos show that the bombardment of several neighborhoods in Homs is continuing.

byline.contributor: Hala Droubi contributed reporting from Beirut, Alan Cowell from London, and an employee of The New York Times from Damascus, Syria.

lead_paragraph: Six United Nations military observers arrived overnight and were ready to begin, depending on the cooperation of the Syrian government, a spokesman for the special envoy Kofi Annan said.

headline.seo: Syria Cease-Fire Monitors Arrive From U.N.
headline.main: U.N. Truce Observers Arrive in Syria as Shelling Continues

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
